steps: 1. Fill the empty cell that is orthogonally surrounded by the four green (3) cells at positions (1,2), (2,1), (2,3), (3,2) with color 4.
2. Fill the empty cell that is orthogonally surrounded by the four green (3) cells at positions (2,3), (3,2), (3,4), (4,3) with color 4.
3. Do not change any other cells (leave all existing green (3) cells and the black background (0) unchanged).

1. Locate the single black cell that is orthogonally surrounded by green pixels — specifically the empty cell that has green pixels at its up, down, left and right neighbors (the cell between the greens at (3,6), (5,6), (4,5) and (4,7)).
2. Fill that single black cell with color 4 (set the cell at row 4, column 6 (0-indexed) from 0 to 4).
3. Leave every other pixel unchanged (do not modify any other color-3 green pixels or any background pixels).
1. Color the four empty cells that form the left column of the ring’s interior with color 4 — specifically cells at (row 3, col 4), (row 4, col 4), (row 5, col 4), (row 6, col 4).
2. Color the four empty cells that form the right column of the ring’s interior with color 4 — specifically cells at (row 3, col 5), (row 4, col 5), (row 5, col 5), (row 6, col 5).
3. Color the single remaining empty cell inside the ring to the right of the top interior row with color 4 — cell (row 3, col 7).
1. Fill the 2×2 empty hole inside the upper-left hollow 4×4 square (the inner hole of the top big square) with color 4 — color its four interior cells yellow.

2. Complete the lower-left foot: the small L-shaped trio of green pixels attached beneath/left of the lower hollow square has one empty cell that would make a full 2×2 block — color that single empty cell yellow (color 4).
3. Complete the lower-right foot: the small foot cluster at the extreme lower-right is missing one cell to become a 2×2 block — color that single empty cell yellow (color 4).
